name: semiru
text: Oh Hiram, you randy blacksmith you.

name: riazm
text: Hiram is the master of post syphillis apology letters.

name: zzzleepy
text: hee hee . . . ray has a homo-erotic digital fantasy

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Hey, if anyone calls him gay, he'll just sit there not being gay, and they'll be wrong.

name: rowboat
text: That line only works so many times. I'm getting skeptical. I'm not sayin' he doesn't dig on chicks, just that he may not be too particular one way or the other when the mood is right. Obviously, Hiram's smithy shop just had a certain ambiance.

name: tronwell
text: plus SO much coconut rum.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: Dad, this is Randy.

name: greenkoolayd
text: i wonder how well that goes with sheet cake.

name: charchar
text: The hammerblows (no pun inteneded...yet) ringing out like bells, Hiram all sweaty in the soft glow of the forges...

name: heatbag
text:
Oregon Trail, you were the merciless pioneer life that killed all my childhood friends.
Now you are the emulation that kills all my adult friends.

name: brinkmanship
text:
Merciless? even though syphilis was entirely absent from the original? Plus stranded desperate cannibalism, a major oversight.
Still, beats being eaten by a grue.

name: shirt145
text: Damn you dysentery! Damn your cold heart to heck!  Ah well... I just wanted to shoot squirrels anyway.

name: suprememongoose
text: The thing I hated about that game was that they made us play it even though we already lived in Oregon

name: somanywhales
text: dude that makes this game your heritage

name: suprememongoose
text: Thinking back on the contents of said game, I'm not sure how I feel about that. *considers this new angle*

name: closefriend
text: To be fair, I never could get all the way to Oregon.

name: relaxing
text: Man, you missed out on the best part of the game!

name: luckypyjamas
text:
all going down that river

all dodging rocks in the water

name: macdaddyw
text: I got to it twice. When you did, you were the hero of the class. You had to hurry up and half ass your homework just so you had enough time to devote to that game. God I loved that game.

name: jthm_guitarist
text:
I know what you mean man!
In my class though, we only spent like a few days on the game.

name: slab64
text: Reminds me of the way my homeboys and I used to play PC games back in small times, in the olden days before multiplayer. One dude navigates, everyone else spectates.

name: speedwell
text: division of labor: one kid with point click prowess and another diligently manning home row and down goes diablo

name: zeal
text: Earthsiege 2.  Flying Herc.  He shoots, I control the engines.

name: soticoto
text:
We weren't allowed to use mathematical equipment when we played Scorched Earth matches on the DOS, but that didn't stop my comrades using my Autistic powers of angle-deduction to guarantee the win.
... I wasn't allowed to play it myself though.

name: achilleselbow
text: Yea but come on, you don't really need help for that. If you're talking about the first one, my Rogue's dexterity was so high at that point that Diablo just stood there recoiling as I pumped arrows into him. Pretty anti-climactic.

name: jollysaintpete
text: On Hardcore mode? I have got my doubts

name: jollysaintpete
text: BRILLIANT

name: belgand
text: Yeah. How come nobody plays games that way anymore? Is nobody interested in new games? Man, I could never get my friends to come over and play games and put up with that shit at all.

name: madnes
text: A comment left by madnes was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by entropyends, djwhiterabbit, Jesler729, Connellingus, DougTheHead, lateadopter, joebot)

name: skiddyfisk
text: I remember growing up in Oregon playing that on the school's one computer in 1996 and thinking "cool, we're in a video game"

name: audhumla
text: A comment left by audhumla was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by stormypinkness, Jesler729, captneko, libelandslander)

name: geysershitdick
text: A comment left by geysershitdick was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by MilesDonovan, erributtz, mattylite)

name: griggs_although
text: A comment left by griggs_although was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by lux, logic, tropicana)

name: xi
text: I really can't see how you'd call it "hellish". I mean... I have you been to Alaska?

name: audhumla
text: i am in corvallis

name: catgrl131
text: Seriously, who the hell goes to Cornwallis?

name: lux
text: I know!

name: bossadelic
text: seriously!

name: zapatos
text:
Hell: fire brimstone and death

fuckin... NM AZ NV anyone?

name: libelandslander
text:
Sorry, I lamed you before I noticed that you live in Cowvallis.
Condolences, dude, but Portland is not that far of a drive.

name: neoboman
text: There's no better word to describe the game Oregon Trail than "decent"

name: scramblesthedog
text: The look on Ray's face in the last three panels is a perfect bit of cartooning.

name: philosophe
text: I remember back in small times I played Oregon Trail and named my party Mom, Dad, etc. Then when the game told me "Mom died of dysentery" I cried. This happened a couple of times.

name: charchar
text: I would name my characters after kids from class, and feed them jimsonweed if they'd pissed me off. "Your whole party has contracted dysentery..."

name: odei
text: Phillipe, Phillipe, Phillipe.

name: tttt
text: game is mad decent.

name: pitseleh
text: Whatever you do, don't attempt to ford the fucking river, man. It always ends badly.

name: heyoo
text: I played the game on the internet and literally everyone died when I attempted to float my wagon across the river. It was so sad when both "Asshole" and "Faggy" died.

name: apocowarg
text: I forded that bitch ALL the time.

name: layzerblade
text: When it's shallow enough to ford, it's actually less safe to caulk.

name: deusoma
text: It's the "He wrote!" that does it for me.

name: snowman
text: A comment left by snowman was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by fattypneumonia, smilebuddha, Audhumla)

name: snowman
text: Sorry, that was dick.

name: j03y
text: did syphillis even come to america at that time???

name: professoryes
text: If it did, it came through Hiram.

name: belgand
text: That is true. It was indeed because Hiram did come quite a lot.

name: trollcollins
text: Yes. Well before that time. Blame sailors and prostitutes!

name: spinynorman
text: Frenchified!

name: layzerblade
text: Many actually trace syphilis to the New World, one of comparably few diseases that made it from America to Europe instead of the other way around.

name: luckypyjamas
text:
also, this comic is titled "oregon tail"


i just thought i'd point that out

name: mattylite
text: Chubbied for making my brain stop filling in the "r" automatically.  I would have had no idea.

name: i_love_kate
text: I assumed it was a pun on the game's name... and, y'know... sex.

name: luckypyjamas
text:
i didn't think about it as a pun on sex

but

okay

yeah

name: cameasiam
text: the alt text makes this a 6.

name: robstrong
text: I believe the past tense of the verb "to shoe" is "shod".

name: caseyb3
text:
Fun fact: There are actually four (five?) numbered versions of the Oregon Trail now, along with the many many many 'minor' upgrades.

Oregon Trail II is a serious player, in spite of the somewhat silly FMV stuff.

name: rbisme
text: so juicy

name: snowman
text: I love this one because it's such a good stand-alone strip.  Anyone could read this, regardless of story arc context, and it's just really concise and funny.

name: mikeronomicon
text: I just learned that they made a new 3d version of this. I must play it to see if it has smallpox-laden blankets and syphilis.

name: genequagmire
text: This would be the best remake ever.

name: greenkoolayd
text: how do you pronounce "oregon"?  ORE-eh-gehn or organ?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: like the keyed instrument.

name: greenkoolayd
text: accordian?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: pft...'or-gone'..what in the dogg.
